resources.string: Welcome to Software Engineering Course CS4500 Chess Game!
- Check: Is when on players king can be taken by any piece of the opponent.
- CheckMate: If a player is in the Check position and cannot make anymore moves, then the player automatically loses the game
- Stalemate: If a player cannot make any more moves, but not in a check position, the game is stalemated and a automatic tie
- If a Player touches one of the pieces, a move must be made.

- Castling; If king or rook has not moved, the kind is not in check, the king wonâ€™t move over or to a square that was attacked by the enemy, all the square between the rook and the king are empty and the king and rook occupy the same row, then the castling move can be implemented. With castling, the king has to move two squares towards the rook then the rook has to move to the king new square

- Taking En-Passant: When a pawn makes a double step from the second row to the fourth row, and there is an enemy pawn on an adjacent square on the fourth row, then this enemy pawn inthe next move may move diagonally to the square that was passed over by the double-stepping pawn, which is on the third row. In this same move, the double-stepping pawn is taken. This taking en-passant must be done directly: if the player who could take en-passant does not do this in the first move after the double step, this pawn cannot be taken anymore by an en-passant move.
